snippet: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. announced new steps intended to curb soaring spending on prisons and help correct what he regards as unfairness in the justice system.
abstract: Obama administration, in major policy shift, will move to ease overcrowding in federal prisons by ordering prosecutors to sidestep federal mandatory minimum sentencing laws in certain low-level drug cases; shift, which will be announced by Attorney Gen Eric H Holder Jr, is intended to curb soaring taxpayer spending on prisons and help correct what he regards as unfairness in justice system.
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. announced new steps intended to curb soaring spending on prisons and help correct what he regards as unfairness in the justice system.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Seeks to Curtail Stiff Drug Sentences
headline.print_headline: Dept. Of Justice Seeks To Curtail Stiff Drug Terms
